meanings.definition: The yellow part of an egg.
meanings.sent1: The yelk of the egg adds color to the omelette.
meanings.sent2: She carefully separated the yelk from the egg white.
meanings.sent3: The yelk looked like a small ball of sunshine in the bowl.
meanings.sent4: The yelk resembled a golden treasure hidden within the egg.
meanings.sent5: The bright yelk stood out against the white of the egg shell.

meanings.definition: To remove the yelk from an egg.
meanings.sent1: He had to yelk out the egg before baking the cake.
meanings.sent2: They yelked the eggs swiftly for the recipe.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally yelked the egg too forcefully, causing a mess.
meanings.sent4: The chef expertly yelked the eggs with precision and skill.
meanings.sent5: Yelking the eggs requires a gentle touch to avoid breaking the yelk.
